question_text: When replacing a laptop drive, which of the following must be confirmed before physically installing a new drive?
answer_options: That the new drive has a valid partition table
That the BIOS is set to UEFI mode
That the form factor and connector match the drive bay
That an OS is already installed on the new drive
correct_answer: That the form factor and connector match the drive bay
explanation: Incompatibility in connector or form factor (e.g., trying to use M.2 in a 2.5 inch bay) will prevent installation entirely.
